text: VETS30031 / VETS90123 Animals in Extensive Production Systems Challenges for the dairy industry – climatic and economic Megan Thomas megan.thomas@unimelb.edu.au 2 Economic issues • Low milk prices, driven by supermarket competition (culminating in One $ milk) 3 Economic issues • Overall, world dairy prices don’t change much • Australia's share in the global dairy market fell from 16 per cent in the 1990s to 6 per cent in 2018-19 4 Economic issues • Increasing costs of water in irrigated regions (see climate) 5 abc.net.au Climatic issues • Drought • Need to buy feed and water • Increasing costs of water • Flooding events • Fires 6 maitlandmercury.com.au abc.net.au Climatic issues 7 • Our climate is changing: • Short term increase in variability of climatic conditions • Long term increase in temperatures - Impacts on cows - heat stress - Impacts on water supplies – increased cost of water, decreased availability - Impacts on pasture growth – longer, drier summers; warmer winters with fewer frosts Sustainability What do you think a sustainable dairy industry needs to consider? 8 AEPS – DAIRY WEEK 2 9
